newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Rio state sees Banerj sell-off in March.
newsitem.headline: Rio state sees Banerj sell-off in March.

text.p: Rio de Janeiro state expects to privatize its Banerj bank in March once the Senate gives final approval to the state's debt rollover, a spokeswoman for Rio's government said.
The passage of the state's debt deal would pave the way for the publication of Banerj's new tender documents and allow the bank's auction to take place in the second week of March, she said.
The spokeswoman said Rio officials expect the Senate to look at the state's debt refinancing deal between February 17 and 24.
Last week, senators gave initial approval to an accord between Rio de Janeiro state and the federal government to refinance 11.6 billion reais in state debt over 30 years.
The deal calls for rescheduling 5.25 billion reais in state debt and 3.4 billion reais in Banerj debt.

Banerj, whose sell-off has been postponed twice due to court rulings, would be the first of Brazilian state banks to be privatized. Last week, Minas Gerais state government published the bid specifications for the sale of its state bank Credireal, scheduled for April 30.
